alert.note: Alert for Grant (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 9:27PM EDT until April 13 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM EDT FOR GRANT COUNTY... At 927 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Williamstown, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Corinth, Stewartsville, Cherry Grove, Northcutt, Williamstown Lake, Twin Bridges, Keefer, Camp Northward, Sherman, Lawrenceville and Cordova. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 143 and 165. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
